 28 var require,
 29     define;

 31 (function () {
 32     var modules = {};
 33 
 34     function build(module) {
 35         var factory = module.factory;
 36         module.exports = {};
 37         delete module.factory;
 38         factory(require, module.exports, module);
 39         return module.exports;
 40     }
 41 
 42     require = function (id) {
 43         if (!modules[id]) {
 44             throw "module " + id + " not found";
 45         }
 46         return modules[id].factory ? build(modules[id]) : modules[id].exports;
 47     };
 48 
 49     define = function (id, factory) {
 50         if (modules[id]) {
 51             throw "module " + id + " already defined";
 52         }
 53 
 54         modules[id] = {
 55             id: id,
 56             factory: factory
 57         };
 58     };
 59 
 60     define.remove = function (id) {
 61         delete modules[id];
 62     };
 63 
 64 })();

 91 var m_window_addEventListener = window.addEventListener;

 94 /**
 95  * Houses custom event handlers to intercept on document + window event listeners.
 96  */
 97 var documentEventHandlers = {},
 98     windowEventHandlers = {};

100 document.addEventListener = function(evt, handler, capture) {
101     var e = evt.toLowerCase();
102     if (typeof documentEventHandlers[e] != 'undefined') {
103         if (evt === 'deviceready') {
104             documentEventHandlers[e].subscribeOnce(handler);
105         } else {
106             documentEventHandlers[e].subscribe(handler);
107         }
108     } else {
109         m_document_addEventListener.call(document, evt, handler, capture);
110     }
111 };
112 
113 window.addEventListener = function(evt, handler, capture) {
114     var e = evt.toLowerCase();
115     if (typeof windowEventHandlers[e] != 'undefined') {
116         windowEventHandlers[e].subscribe(handler);
117     } else {
118         m_window_addEventListener.call(window, evt, handler, capture);
119     }
120 };
121 
122 document.removeEventListener = function(evt, handler, capture) {
123     var e = evt.toLowerCase();
124     // If unsubcribing from an event that is handled by a plugin
125     if (typeof documentEventHandlers[e] != "undefined") {
126         documentEventHandlers[e].unsubscribe(handler);
127     } else {
128         m_document_removeEventListener.call(document, evt, handler, capture);
129     }
130 };
131 
132 window.removeEventListener = function(evt, handler, capture) {
133     var e = evt.toLowerCase();
134     // If unsubcribing from an event that is handled by a plugin
135     if (typeof windowEventHandlers[e] != "undefined") {
136         windowEventHandlers[e].unsubscribe(handler);
137     } else {
138         m_window_removeEventListener.call(window, evt, handler, capture);
139     }
140 };

142 function createEvent(type, data) {
143     var event = document.createEvent('Events');
144     event.initEvent(type, false, false);
145     if (data) {
146         for (var i in data) {
147             if (data.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
148                 event[i] = data[i];
149             }
150         }
151     }
152     return event;
153 }

244     callbackSuccess: function(callbackId, args) {

316 // Adds deprecation warnings to functions of an object (but only logs a message once)
317 function deprecateFunctions(obj, objLabel) {
318     var newObj = {};
319     var logHash = {};
320     for (var i in obj) {
321         if (obj.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
322             if (typeof obj[i] == 'function') {
323                 newObj[i] = (function(prop){
324                     var oldFunk = obj[prop];
325                     var funkId = objLabel + '_' + prop;
326                     return function() {
327                         if (!logHash[funkId]) {
328                             console.log('[DEPRECATION NOTICE] The "' + objLabel + '" global will be removed in version 2.0, please use lowercase "cordova".');
329                             logHash[funkId] = true;
330                         }
331                         oldFunk.apply(obj, arguments);
332                     };
333                 })(i);
334             } else {
335                 newObj[i] = (function(prop) { return obj[prop]; })(i);
336             }
337         }
338     }
339     return newObj;
340 }

365 // file: lib/common/builder.js
366 define("cordova/builder", function(require, exports, module) {
367 var utils = require('cordova/utils');
368 
369 function each(objects, func, context) {
370     for (var prop in objects) {
371         if (objects.hasOwnProperty(prop)) {
372             func.apply(context, [objects[prop], prop]);
373         }
374     }
375 }
376 
377 function include(parent, objects, clobber, merge) {
378     each(objects, function (obj, key) {
379         try {
380           var result = obj.path ? require(obj.path) : {};
381 
382           if (clobber) {
383               // Clobber if it doesn't exist.
384               if (typeof parent[key] === 'undefined') {
385                   parent[key] = result;
386               } else if (typeof obj.path !== 'undefined') {
387                   // If merging, merge properties onto parent, otherwise, clobber.
388                   if (merge) {
389                       recursiveMerge(parent[key], result);
390                   } else {
391                       parent[key] = result;
392                   }
393               }
394               result = parent[key];
395           } else {
396             // Overwrite if not currently defined.
397             if (typeof parent[key] == 'undefined') {
398               parent[key] = result;
399             } else if (merge && typeof obj.path !== 'undefined') {
400               // If merging, merge parent onto result
401               recursiveMerge(result, parent[key]);
402               parent[key] = result;
403             } else {
404               // Set result to what already exists, so we can build children into it if they exist.
405               result = parent[key];
406             }
407           }
408 
409           if (obj.children) {
410             include(result, obj.children, clobber, merge);
411           }
412         } catch(e) {
413           utils.alert('Exception building cordova JS globals: ' + e + ' for key "' + key + '"');
414         }
415     });
416 }
417 
418 /**
419  * Merge properties from one object onto another recursively.  Properties from
420  * the src object will overwrite existing target property.
421  *
422  * @param target Object to merge properties into.
423  * @param src Object to merge properties from.
424  */
425 function recursiveMerge(target, src) {
426     for (var prop in src) {
427         if (src.hasOwnProperty(prop)) {
428             if (typeof target.prototype !== 'undefined' && target.prototype.constructor === target) {
429                 // If the target object is a constructor override off prototype.
430                 target.prototype[prop] = src[prop];
431             } else {
432                 target[prop] = typeof src[prop] === 'object' ? recursiveMerge(
433                         target[prop], src[prop]) : src[prop];
434             }
435         }
436     }
437     return target;
438 }
439 
440 module.exports = {
441     build: function (objects) {
442         return {
443             intoButDontClobber: function (target) {
444                 include(target, objects, false, false);
445             },
446             intoAndClobber: function(target) {
447                 include(target, objects, true, false);
448             },
449             intoAndMerge: function(target) {
450                 include(target, objects, true, true);
451             }
452         };
453     }
454 };

458 // file: lib/common/channel.js
459 define("cordova/channel", function(require, exports, module) {
460 var utils = require('cordova/utils');
461 
462 /**
463  * Custom pub-sub "channel" that can have functions subscribed to it
464  * This object is used to define and control firing of events for
465  * cordova initialization.
466  *
467  * The order of events during page load and Cordova startup is as follows:
468  *
469  * onDOMContentLoaded         Internal event that is received when the web page is loaded and parsed.
470  * onNativeReady              Internal event that indicates the Cordova native side is ready.
471  * onCordovaReady             Internal event fired when all Cordova JavaScript objects have been created.
472  * onCordovaInfoReady         Internal event fired when device properties are available.
473  * onCordovaConnectionReady   Internal event fired when the connection property has been set.
474  * onDeviceReady              User event fired to indicate that Cordova is ready
475  * onResume                   User event fired to indicate a start/resume lifecycle event
476  * onPause                    User event fired to indicate a pause lifecycle event
477  * onDestroy                  Internal event fired when app is being destroyed (User should use window.onunload event, not this one).
478  *
479  * The only Cordova events that user code should register for are:
480  *      deviceready           Cordova native code is initialized and Cordova APIs can be called from JavaScript
481  *      pause                 App has moved to background
482  *      resume                App has returned to foreground
483  *
484  * Listeners can be registered as:
485  *      document.addEventListener("deviceready", myDeviceReadyListener, false);
486  *      document.addEventListener("resume", myResumeListener, false);
487  *      document.addEventListener("pause", myPauseListener, false);
488  *
489  * The DOM lifecycle events should be used for saving and restoring state
490  *      window.onload
491  *      window.onunload
492  *
493  */
494 
495 /**
496  * Channel
497  * @constructor
498  * @param type  String the channel name
499  * @param opts  Object options to pass into the channel, currently
500  *                     supports:
501  *                     onSubscribe: callback that fires when
502  *                       something subscribes to the Channel. Sets
503  *                       context to the Channel.
504  *                     onUnsubscribe: callback that fires when
505  *                       something unsubscribes to the Channel. Sets
506  *                       context to the Channel.
507  */
508 var Channel = function(type, opts) {
509     this.type = type;
510     this.handlers = {};
511     this.numHandlers = 0;
512     this.guid = 1;
513     this.fired = false;
514     this.enabled = true;
515     this.events = {
516         onSubscribe:null,
517         onUnsubscribe:null
518     };
519     if (opts) {
520         if (opts.onSubscribe) this.events.onSubscribe = opts.onSubscribe;
521         if (opts.onUnsubscribe) this.events.onUnsubscribe = opts.onUnsubscribe;
522     }
523 },
524     channel = {
525         /**
526          * Calls the provided function only after all of the channels specified
527          * have been fired.
528          */
529         join: function (h, c) {
530             var i = c.length;
531             var len = i;
532             var f = function() {
533                 if (!(--i)) h();
534             };
535             for (var j=0; j<len; j++) {
536                 !c[j].fired?c[j].subscribeOnce(f):i--;
537             }
538             if (!i) h();
539         },
540         create: function (type, opts) {
541             channel[type] = new Channel(type, opts);
542             return channel[type];
543         },
544 
545         /**
546          * cordova Channels that must fire before "deviceready" is fired.
547          */
548         deviceReadyChannelsArray: [],
549         deviceReadyChannelsMap: {},
550 
551         /**
552          * Indicate that a feature needs to be initialized before it is ready to be used.
553          * This holds up Cordova's "deviceready" event until the feature has been initialized
554          * and Cordova.initComplete(feature) is called.
555          *
556          * @param feature {String}     The unique feature name
557          */
558         waitForInitialization: function(feature) {
559             if (feature) {
560                 var c = null;
561                 if (this[feature]) {
562                     c = this[feature];
563                 }
564                 else {
565                     c = this.create(feature);
566                 }
567                 this.deviceReadyChannelsMap[feature] = c;
568                 this.deviceReadyChannelsArray.push(c);
569             }
570         },
571 
572         /**
573          * Indicate that initialization code has completed and the feature is ready to be used.
574          *
575          * @param feature {String}     The unique feature name
576          */
577         initializationComplete: function(feature) {
578             var c = this.deviceReadyChannelsMap[feature];
579             if (c) {
580                 c.fire();
581             }
582         }
583     };
584 
585 function forceFunction(f) {
586     if (f === null || f === undefined || typeof f != 'function') throw "Function required as first argument!";
587 }
588 
589 /**
590  * Subscribes the given function to the channel. Any time that
591  * Channel.fire is called so too will the function.
592  * Optionally specify an execution context for the function
593  * and a guid that can be used to stop subscribing to the channel.
594  * Returns the guid.
595  */
596 Channel.prototype.subscribe = function(f, c, g) {
597     // need a function to call
598     forceFunction(f);
599 
600     var func = f;
601     if (typeof c == "object") { func = utils.close(c, f); }
602 
603     g = g || func.observer_guid || f.observer_guid;
604     if (!g) {
605         // first time we've seen this subscriber
606         g = this.guid++;
607     }
608     else {
609         // subscriber already handled; dont set it twice
610         return g;
611     }
612     func.observer_guid = g;
613     f.observer_guid = g;
614     this.handlers[g] = func;
615     this.numHandlers++;
616     if (this.events.onSubscribe) this.events.onSubscribe.call(this);
617     if (this.fired) func.call(this);
618     return g;
619 };
620 
621 /**
622  * Like subscribe but the function is only called once and then it
623  * auto-unsubscribes itself.
624  */
625 Channel.prototype.subscribeOnce = function(f, c) {
626     // need a function to call
627     forceFunction(f);
628 
629     var g = null;
630     var _this = this;
631     var m = function() {
632         f.apply(c || null, arguments);
633         _this.unsubscribe(g);
634     };
635     if (this.fired) {
636         if (typeof c == "object") { f = utils.close(c, f); }
637         f.apply(this, this.fireArgs);
638     } else {
639         g = this.subscribe(m);
640     }
641     return g;
642 };
643 
644 /**
645  * Unsubscribes the function with the given guid from the channel.
646  */
647 Channel.prototype.unsubscribe = function(g) {
648     // need a function to unsubscribe
649     if (g === null || g === undefined) { throw "You must pass _something_ into Channel.unsubscribe"; }
650 
651     if (typeof g == 'function') { g = g.observer_guid; }
652     var handler = this.handlers[g];
653     if (handler) {
654         if (handler.observer_guid) handler.observer_guid=null;
655         this.handlers[g] = null;
656         delete this.handlers[g];
657         this.numHandlers--;
658         if (this.events.onUnsubscribe) this.events.onUnsubscribe.call(this);
659     }
660 };
661 
662 /**
663  * Calls all functions subscribed to this channel.
664  */
665 Channel.prototype.fire = function(e) {
666     if (this.enabled) {
667         var fail = false;
668         this.fired = true;
669         for (var item in this.handlers) {
670             var handler = this.handlers[item];
671             if (typeof handler == 'function') {
672                 var rv = (handler.apply(this, arguments)===false);
673                 fail = fail || rv;
674             }
675         }
676         this.fireArgs = arguments;
677         return !fail;
678     }
679     return true;
680 };
681 
682 // defining them here so they are ready super fast!
683 // DOM event that is received when the web page is loaded and parsed.
684 channel.create('onDOMContentLoaded');
685 
686 // Event to indicate the Cordova native side is ready.
687 channel.create('onNativeReady');
688 
689 // Event to indicate that all Cordova JavaScript objects have been created
690 // and it's time to run plugin constructors.
691 channel.create('onCordovaReady');
692 
693 // Event to indicate that device properties are available
694 channel.create('onCordovaInfoReady');
695 
696 // Event to indicate that the connection property has been set.
697 channel.create('onCordovaConnectionReady');
698 
699 // Event to indicate that Cordova is ready
700 channel.create('onDeviceReady');
701 
702 // Event to indicate a resume lifecycle event
703 channel.create('onResume');
704 
705 // Event to indicate a pause lifecycle event
706 channel.create('onPause');
707 
708 // Event to indicate a destroy lifecycle event
709 channel.create('onDestroy');
710 
711 // Channels that must fire before "deviceready" is fired.
712 channel.waitForInitialization('onCordovaReady');
713 channel.waitForInitialization('onCordovaInfoReady');
714 channel.waitForInitialization('onCordovaConnectionReady');
715 
716 module.exports = channel;
717 
718 });

928 // file: lib/android/exec.js
929 define("cordova/exec", function(require, exports, module) {
930 /**
931  * Execute a cordova command.  It is up to the native side whether this action
932  * is synchronous or asynchronous.  The native side can return:
933  *      Synchronous: PluginResult object as a JSON string
934  *      Asynchrounous: Empty string ""
935  * If async, the native side will cordova.callbackSuccess or cordova.callbackError,
936  * depending upon the result of the action.
937  *
938  * @param {Function} success    The success callback
939  * @param {Function} fail       The fail callback
940  * @param {String} service      The name of the service to use
941  * @param {String} action       Action to be run in cordova
942  * @param {String[]} [args]     Zero or more arguments to pass to the method
943  */
944 var cordova = require('cordova');
945 
946 module.exports = function(success, fail, service, action, args) {
947   try {
948     var callbackId = service + cordova.callbackId++;
949     if (success || fail) {
950         cordova.callbacks[callbackId] = {success:success, fail:fail};
951     }
952 
953     var r = prompt(JSON.stringify(args), "gap:"+JSON.stringify([service, action, callbackId, true]));
954 
955     // If a result was returned
956     if (r.length > 0) {
957         var v;
958         eval("v="+r+";");
959 
960         // If status is OK, then return value back to caller
961         if (v.status === cordova.callbackStatus.OK) {
962 
963             // If there is a success callback, then call it now with
964             // returned value
965             if (success) {
966                 try {
967                     success(v.message);
968                 } catch (e) {
969                     console.log("Error in success callback: " + callbackId  + " = " + e);
970                 }
971 
972                 // Clear callback if not expecting any more results
973                 if (!v.keepCallback) {
974                     delete cordova.callbacks[callbackId];
975                 }
976             }
977             return v.message;
978         }
979 
980         // If no result
981         else if (v.status === cordova.callbackStatus.NO_RESULT) {
982             // Clear callback if not expecting any more results
983             if (!v.keepCallback) {
984                 delete cordova.callbacks[callbackId];
985             }
986         }
987 
988         // If error, then display error
989         else {
990             console.log("Error: Status="+v.status+" Message="+v.message);
991 
992             // If there is a fail callback, then call it now with returned value
993             if (fail) {
994                 try {
995                     fail(v.message);
996                 }
997                 catch (e1) {
998                     console.log("Error in error callback: "+callbackId+" = "+e1);
999                 }
1000 
1001                 // Clear callback if not expecting any more results
1002                 if (!v.keepCallback) {
1003                     delete cordova.callbacks[callbackId];
1004                 }
1005             }
1006             return null;
1007         }
1008     }
1009   } catch (e2) {
1010     console.log("Error: "+e2);
1011   }
1012 };
1013 
1014 });
1015 
1016 // file: lib/android/platform.js
1017 define("cordova/platform", function(require, exports, module) {
1018 module.exports = {
1019     id: "android",
1020     initialize:function() {
1021         var channel = require("cordova/channel"),
1022             cordova = require('cordova'),
1023             callback = require('cordova/plugin/android/callback'),
1024             polling = require('cordova/plugin/android/polling'),
1025             exec = require('cordova/exec');
1026 
1027         channel.onDestroy.subscribe(function() {
1028             cordova.shuttingDown = true;
1029         });
1030 
1031         // Start listening for XHR callbacks
1032         // Figure out which bridge approach will work on this Android
1033         // device: polling or XHR-based callbacks
1034         setTimeout(function() {
1035             if (cordova.UsePolling) {
1036                 polling();
1037             }
1038             else {
1039                 var isPolling = prompt("usePolling", "gap_callbackServer:");
1040                 cordova.UsePolling = isPolling;
1041                 if (isPolling == "true") {
1042                     cordova.UsePolling = true;
1043                     polling();
1044                 } else {
1045                     cordova.UsePolling = false;
1046                     callback();
1047                 }
1048             }
1049         }, 1);
1050 
1051         // Inject a listener for the backbutton on the document.
1052         var backButtonChannel = cordova.addDocumentEventHandler('backbutton', {
1053             onSubscribe:function() {
1054                 // If we just attached the first handler, let native know we need to override the back button.
1055                 if (this.numHandlers === 1) {
1056                     exec(null, null, "App", "overrideBackbutton", [true]);
1057                 }
1058             },
1059             onUnsubscribe:function() {
1060                 // If we just detached the last handler, let native know we no longer override the back button.
1061                 if (this.numHandlers === 0) {
1062                     exec(null, null, "App", "overrideBackbutton", [false]);
1063                 }
1064             }
1065         });
1066 
1067         // Add hardware MENU and SEARCH button handlers
1068         cordova.addDocumentEventHandler('menubutton');
1069         cordova.addDocumentEventHandler('searchbutton');
1070 
1071         // Figure out if we need to shim-in localStorage and WebSQL
1072         // support from the native side.
1073         var storage = require('cordova/plugin/android/storage');
1074 
1075         // First patch WebSQL if necessary
1076         if (typeof window.openDatabase == 'undefined') {
1077             // Not defined, create an openDatabase function for all to use!
1078             window.openDatabase = storage.openDatabase;
1079         } else {
1080             // Defined, but some Android devices will throw a SECURITY_ERR -
1081             // so we wrap the whole thing in a try-catch and shim in our own
1082             // if the device has Android bug 16175.
1083             var originalOpenDatabase = window.openDatabase;
1084             window.openDatabase = function(name, version, desc, size) {
1085                 var db = null;
1086                 try {
1087                     db = originalOpenDatabase(name, version, desc, size);
1088                 }
1089                 catch (ex) {
1090                     if (ex.code === 18) {
1091                         db = null;
1092                     } else {
1093                         throw ex;
1094                     }
1095                 }
1096 
1097                 if (db === null) {
1098                     return storage.openDatabase(name, version, desc, size);
1099                 }
1100                 else {
1101                     return db;
1102                 }
1103 
1104             };
1105         }
1106 
1107         // Patch localStorage if necessary
1108         if (typeof window.localStorage == 'undefined' || window.localStorage === null) {
1109             window.localStorage = new storage.CupcakeLocalStorage();
1110         }
1111 
1112         // Let native code know we are all done on the JS side.
1113         // Native code will then un-hide the WebView.
1114         channel.join(function() {
1115             prompt("", "gap_init:");
1116         }, [channel.onCordovaReady]);
1117     },
1118     objects: {
1119         cordova: {
1120             children: {
1121                 JSCallback:{
1122                     path:"cordova/plugin/android/callback"
1123                 },
1124                 JSCallbackPolling:{
1125                     path:"cordova/plugin/android/polling"
1126                 }
1127             }
1128         },
1129         navigator: {
1130             children: {
1131                 app:{
1132                     path: "cordova/plugin/android/app"
1133                 }
1134             }
1135         },
1136         device:{
1137             path: "cordova/plugin/android/device"
1138         },
1139         File: { // exists natively on Android WebView, override
1140             path: "cordova/plugin/File"
1141         },
1142         FileReader: { // exists natively on Android WebView, override
1143             path: "cordova/plugin/FileReader"
1144         },
1145         FileError: { //exists natively on Android WebView on Android 4.x
1146             path: "cordova/plugin/FileError"
1147         },
1148         MediaError: { // exists natively on Android WebView on Android 4.x
1149             path: "cordova/plugin/MediaError"
1150         }
1151     },
1152     merges: {
1153         navigator: {
1154             children: {
1155                 notification: {
1156                     path: 'cordova/plugin/android/notification'
1157                 }
1158             }
1159         }
1160     }
1161 };

1178 // file: lib/common/plugin/Camera.js
1179 define("cordova/plugin/Camera", function(require, exports, module) {
1180 var exec = require('cordova/exec'),
1181     Camera = require('cordova/plugin/CameraConstants');
1182 
1183 var cameraExport = {};
1184 
1185 // Tack on the Camera Constants to the base camera plugin.
1186 for (var key in Camera) {
1187     cameraExport[key] = Camera[key];
1188 }
1189 
1190 /**
1191  * Gets a picture from source defined by "options.sourceType", and returns the
1192  * image as defined by the "options.destinationType" option.
1193 
1194  * The defaults are sourceType=CAMERA and destinationType=FILE_URI.
1195  *
1196  * @param {Function} successCallback
1197  * @param {Function} errorCallback
1198  * @param {Object} options
1199  */
1200 cameraExport.getPicture = function(successCallback, errorCallback, options) {
1201     // successCallback required
1202     if (typeof successCallback != "function") {
1203         console.log("Camera Error: successCallback is not a function");
1204         return;
1205     }
1206 
1207     // errorCallback optional
1208     if (errorCallback && (typeof errorCallback != "function")) {
1209         console.log("Camera Error: errorCallback is not a function");
1210         return;
1211     }
1212 
1213     var quality = 50;
1214     if (options && typeof options.quality == "number") {
1215         quality = options.quality;
1216     } else if (options && typeof options.quality == "string") {
1217         var qlity = parseInt(options.quality, 10);
1218         if (isNaN(qlity) === false) {
1219             quality = qlity.valueOf();
1220         }
1221     }
1222 
1223     var destinationType = Camera.DestinationType.FILE_URI;
1224     if (typeof options.destinationType == "number") {
1225         destinationType = options.destinationType;
1226     }
1227 
1228     var sourceType = Camera.PictureSourceType.CAMERA;
1229     if (typeof options.sourceType == "number") {
1230         sourceType = options.sourceType;
1231     }
1232 
1233     var targetWidth = -1;
1234     if (typeof options.targetWidth == "number") {
1235         targetWidth = options.targetWidth;
1236     } else if (typeof options.targetWidth == "string") {
1237         var width = parseInt(options.targetWidth, 10);
1238         if (isNaN(width) === false) {
1239             targetWidth = width.valueOf();
1240         }
1241     }
1242 
1243     var targetHeight = -1;
1244     if (typeof options.targetHeight == "number") {
1245         targetHeight = options.targetHeight;
1246     } else if (typeof options.targetHeight == "string") {
1247         var height = parseInt(options.targetHeight, 10);
1248         if (isNaN(height) === false) {
1249             targetHeight = height.valueOf();
1250         }
1251     }
1252 
1253     var encodingType = Camera.EncodingType.JPEG;
1254     if (typeof options.encodingType == "number") {
1255         encodingType = options.encodingType;
1256     }
1257 
1258     var mediaType = Camera.MediaType.PICTURE;
1259     if (typeof options.mediaType == "number") {
1260         mediaType = options.mediaType;
1261     }
1262     var allowEdit = false;
1263     if (typeof options.allowEdit == "boolean") {
1264         allowEdit = options.allowEdit;
1265     } else if (typeof options.allowEdit == "number") {
1266         allowEdit = options.allowEdit <= 0 ? false : true;
1267     }
1268     var correctOrientation = false;
1269     if (typeof options.correctOrientation == "boolean") {
1270         correctOrientation = options.correctOrientation;
1271     } else if (typeof options.correctOrientation == "number") {
1272         correctOrientation = options.correctOrientation <=0 ? false : true;
1273     }
1274     var saveToPhotoAlbum = false;
1275     if (typeof options.saveToPhotoAlbum == "boolean") {
1276         saveToPhotoAlbum = options.saveToPhotoAlbum;
1277     } else if (typeof options.saveToPhotoAlbum == "number") {
1278         saveToPhotoAlbum = options.saveToPhotoAlbum <=0 ? false : true;
1279     }
1280     var popoverOptions = null;
1281     if (typeof options.popoverOptions == "object") {
1282         popoverOptions = options.popoverOptions;
1283     }
1284 
1285     exec(successCallback, errorCallback, "Camera", "takePicture", [quality, destinationType, sourceType, targetWidth, targetHeight, encodingType, mediaType, allowEdit, correctOrientation, saveToPhotoAlbum, popoverOptions]);
1286 };
1287 
1288 cameraExport.cleanup = function(successCallback, errorCallback) {
1289     exec(successCallback, errorCallback, "Camera", "cleanup", []);
1290 }
1291 
1292 module.exports = cameraExport;
1293 });

1487 
1488 /**
1489 * Converts primitives into Complex Object
1490 * Currently only used for Date fields
1491 */
1492 function convertIn(contact) {
1493     var value = contact.birthday;
1494     try {
1495       contact.birthday = new Date(parseFloat(value));
1496     } catch (exception){
1497       console.log("Cordova Contact convertIn error: exception creating date.");
1498     }
1499     return contact;
1500 }
1501 
1502 /**
1503 * Converts Complex objects into primitives
1504 * Only conversion at present is for Dates.
1505 **/
1506 
1507 function convertOut(contact) {
1508     var value = contact.birthday;
1509     if (value !== null) {
1510         // try to make it a Date object if it is not already
1511         if (!utils.isDate(value)){
1512             try {
1513                 value = new Date(value);
1514             } catch(exception){
1515                 value = null;
1516             }
1517         }
1518         if (utils.isDate(value)){
1519             value = value.valueOf(); // convert to milliseconds
1520         }
1521         contact.birthday = value;
1522     }
1523     return contact;
1524 }
1525 
1526 /**
1527 * Contains information about a single contact.
1528 * @constructor
1529 * @param {DOMString} id unique identifier
1530 * @param {DOMString} displayName
1531 * @param {ContactName} name
1532 * @param {DOMString} nickname
1533 * @param {Array.<ContactField>} phoneNumbers array of phone numbers
1534 * @param {Array.<ContactField>} emails array of email addresses
1535 * @param {Array.<ContactAddress>} addresses array of addresses
1536 * @param {Array.<ContactField>} ims instant messaging user ids
1537 * @param {Array.<ContactOrganization>} organizations
1538 * @param {DOMString} birthday contact's birthday
1539 * @param {DOMString} note user notes about contact
1540 * @param {Array.<ContactField>} photos
1541 * @param {Array.<ContactField>} categories
1542 * @param {Array.<ContactField>} urls contact's web sites
1543 */
1544 var Contact = function (id, displayName, name, nickname, phoneNumbers, emails, addresses,
1545     ims, organizations, birthday, note, photos, categories, urls) {
1546     this.id = id || null;
1547     this.rawId = null;
1548     this.displayName = displayName || null;
1549     this.name = name || null; // ContactName
1550     this.nickname = nickname || null;
1551     this.phoneNumbers = phoneNumbers || null; // ContactField[]
1552     this.emails = emails || null; // ContactField[]
1553     this.addresses = addresses || null; // ContactAddress[]
1554     this.ims = ims || null; // ContactField[]
1555     this.organizations = organizations || null; // ContactOrganization[]
1556     this.birthday = birthday || null;
1557     this.note = note || null;
1558     this.photos = photos || null; // ContactField[]
1559     this.categories = categories || null; // ContactField[]
1560     this.urls = urls || null; // ContactField[]
1561 };
1562 
1563 /**
1564 * Removes contact from device storage.
1565 * @param successCB success callback
1566 * @param errorCB error callback
1567 */
1568 Contact.prototype.remove = function(successCB, errorCB) {
1569     var fail = function(code) {
1570         errorCB(new ContactError(code));
1571     };
1572     if (this.id === null) {
1573         fail(ContactError.UNKNOWN_ERROR);
1574     }
1575     else {
1576         exec(successCB, fail, "Contacts", "remove", [this.id]);
1577     }
1578 };
1579 
1580 /**
1581 * Creates a deep copy of this Contact.
1582 * With the contact ID set to null.
1583 * @return copy of this Contact
1584 */
1585 Contact.prototype.clone = function() {
1586     var clonedContact = utils.clone(this);
1587     var i;
1588     clonedContact.id = null;
1589     clonedContact.rawId = null;
1590     // Loop through and clear out any id's in phones, emails, etc.
1591     if (clonedContact.phoneNumbers) {
1592         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.phoneNumbers.length; i++) {
1593             clonedContact.phoneNumbers[i].id = null;
1594         }
1595     }
1596     if (clonedContact.emails) {
1597         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.emails.length; i++) {
1598             clonedContact.emails[i].id = null;
1599         }
1600     }
1601     if (clonedContact.addresses) {
1602         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.addresses.length; i++) {
1603             clonedContact.addresses[i].id = null;
1604         }
1605     }
1606     if (clonedContact.ims) {
1607         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.ims.length; i++) {
1608             clonedContact.ims[i].id = null;
1609         }
1610     }
1611     if (clonedContact.organizations) {
1612         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.organizations.length; i++) {
1613             clonedContact.organizations[i].id = null;
1614         }
1615     }
1616     if (clonedContact.categories) {
1617         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.categories.length; i++) {
1618             clonedContact.categories[i].id = null;
1619         }
1620     }
1621     if (clonedContact.photos) {
1622         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.photos.length; i++) {
1623             clonedContact.photos[i].id = null;
1624         }
1625     }
1626     if (clonedContact.urls) {
1627         for (i = 0; i < clonedContact.urls.length; i++) {
1628             clonedContact.urls[i].id = null;
1629         }
1630     }
1631     return clonedContact;
1632 };
1633 
1634 /**
1635 * Persists contact to device storage.
1636 * @param successCB success callback
1637 * @param errorCB error callback
1638 */
1639 Contact.prototype.save = function(successCB, errorCB) {
1640   var fail = function(code) {
1641       errorCB(new ContactError(code));
1642   };
1643     var success = function(result) {
1644       if (result) {
1645           if (typeof successCB === 'function') {
1646               var fullContact = require('cordova/plugin/contacts').create(result);
1647               successCB(convertIn(fullContact));
1648           }
1649       }
1650       else {
1651           // no Entry object returned
1652           fail(ContactError.UNKNOWN_ERROR);
1653       }
1654   };
1655     var dupContact = convertOut(utils.clone(this));
1656     exec(success, fail, "Contacts", "save", [dupContact]);
1657 };
1658 
1659 
1660 module.exports = Contact;
1661 
1662 });

1945 // file: lib/common/plugin/DirectoryReader.js
1946 define("cordova/plugin/DirectoryReader", function(require, exports, module) {
1947 var exec = require('cordova/exec'),
1948     FileError = require('cordova/plugin/FileError') ;
1949 
1950 /**
1951  * An interface that lists the files and directories in a directory.
1952  */
1953 function DirectoryReader(path) {
1954     this.path = path || null;
1955 }
1956 
1957 /**
1958  * Returns a list of entries from a directory.
1959  *
1960  * @param {Function} successCallback is called with a list of entries
1961  * @param {Function} errorCallback is called with a FileError
1962  */
1963 DirectoryReader.prototype.readEntries = function(successCallback, errorCallback) {
1964     var win = typeof successCallback !== 'function' ? null : function(result) {
1965         var retVal = [];
1966         for (var i=0; i<result.length; i++) {
1967             var entry = null;
1968             if (result[i].isDirectory) {
1969                 entry = new (require('cordova/plugin/DirectoryEntry'))();
1970             }
1971             else if (result[i].isFile) {
1972                 entry = new (require('cordova/plugin/FileEntry'))();
1973             }
1974             entry.isDirectory = result[i].isDirectory;
1975             entry.isFile = result[i].isFile;
1976             entry.name = result[i].name;
1977             entry.fullPath = result[i].fullPath;
1978             retVal.push(entry);
1979         }
1980         successCallback(retVal);
1981     };
1982     var fail = typeof errorCallback !== 'function' ? null : function(code) {
1983         errorCallback(new FileError(code));
1984     };
1985     exec(win, fail, "File", "readEntries", [this.path]);
1986 };
1987 
1988 module.exports = DirectoryReader;
1989

2055 /**
2056  * Move a file or directory to a new location.
2057  *
2058  * @param parent
2059  *            {DirectoryEntry} the directory to which to move this entry
2060  * @param newName
2061  *            {DOMString} new name of the entry, defaults to the current name
2062  * @param successCallback
2063  *            {Function} called with the new DirectoryEntry object
2064  * @param errorCallback
2065  *            {Function} called with a FileError

2067 Entry.prototype.moveTo = function(parent, newName, successCallback, errorCallback) {
2068     var fail = function(code) {
2069         if (typeof errorCallback === 'function') {
2070             errorCallback(new FileError(code));
2071         }
2072     };
2073     // user must specify parent Entry
2074     if (!parent) {
2075         fail(FileError.NOT_FOUND_ERR);
2076         return;
2077     }
2078     // source path
2079     var srcPath = this.fullPath,
2080         // entry name
2081         name = newName || this.name,
2082         success = function(entry) {
2083             if (entry) {
2084                 if (typeof successCallback === 'function') {
2085                     // create appropriate Entry object
2086                     var result = (entry.isDirectory) ? new (require('cordova/plugin/DirectoryEntry'))(entry.name, entry.fullPath) : new (require('cordova/plugin/FileEntry'))(entry.name, entry.fullPath);
2087                     try {
2088                         successCallback(result);
2089                     }
2090                     catch (e) {
2091                         console.log('Error invoking callback: ' + e);
2092                     }
2093                 }
2094             }
2095             else {
2096                 // no Entry object returned
2097                 fail(FileError.NOT_FOUND_ERR);
2098             }
2099         };
2100 
2101     // copy
2102     exec(success, fail, "File", "moveTo", [srcPath, parent.fullPath, name]);
2103 };

2346 var FileReader = function() {
2347     this.fileName = "";
2348

2350 
2351     // File data
2352     this.result = null;
2353 
2354     // Error
2355     this.error = null;
2356 
2357     // Event handlers
2358     this.onloadstart = null;    // When the read starts.
2359     this.onprogress = null;     // While reading (and decoding) file or fileBlob data, and reporting partial file data (progess.loaded/progress.total)
2360     this.onload = null;         // When the read has successfully completed.
2361     this.onerror = null;        // When the read has failed (see errors).
2362     this.onloadend = null;      // When the request has completed (either in success or failure).
2363     this.onabort = null;        // When the read has been aborted. For instance, by invoking the abort() method.

2366 // States
2367 FileReader.EMPTY = 0;
2368 FileReader.LOADING = 1;
2369 FileReader.DONE = 2;

2371 /**

2373  */
2374 FileReader.prototype.abort = function() {
2375     this.result = null;
2376 
2377     if (this.readyState == FileReader.DONE || this.readyState == FileReader.EMPTY) {
2378       return;
2379     }
2380 
2381     this.readyState = FileReader.DONE;
2382 
2383     // If abort callback
2384     if (typeof this.onabort === 'function') {
2385         this.onabort(new ProgressEvent('abort', {target:this}));
2386     }
2387     // If load end callback

2393 /**

2397  * @param encoding      [Optional] (see http://www.iana.org/assignments/character-sets)
2398  */
2399 FileReader.prototype.readAsText = function(file, encoding) {
2400     // Figure out pathing
2401     this.fileName = '';
2402     if (typeof file.fullPath === 'undefined') {
2403         this.fileName = file;
2404     } else {
2405         this.fileName = file.fullPath;
2406     }
2407 
2408     // Already loading something
2409     if (this.readyState == FileReader.LOADING) {
2410         throw new FileError(FileError.INVALID_STATE_ERR);
2411     }
2412 
2413     // LOADING state
2414     this.readyState = FileReader.LOADING;
2415 
2416     // If loadstart callback
2417     if (typeof this.onloadstart === "function") {
2418         this.onloadstart(new ProgressEvent("loadstart", {target:this}));
2419     }
2420 
2421     // Default encoding is UTF-8
2422     var enc = encoding ? encoding : "UTF-8";
2423 
2424     var me = this;
2425 
2426     // Read file
2427     exec(
2428         // Success callback
2429         function(r) {
2430             // If DONE (cancelled), then don't do anything
2431             if (me.readyState === FileReader.DONE) {
2432                 return;
2433             }
2434 
2435             // Save result
2436             me.result = r;
2437 
2438             // If onload callback
2439             if (typeof me.onload === "function") {
2440                 me.onload(new ProgressEvent("load", {target:me}));
2441             }
2442

2444             me.readyState = FileReader.DONE;
2445

2447             if (typeof me.onloadend === "function") {
2448                 me.onloadend(new ProgressEvent("loadend", {target:me}));
2449             }
2450         },
2451         // Error callback
2452         function(e) {
2453             // If DONE (cancelled), then don't do anything
2454             if (me.readyState === FileReader.DONE) {
2455                 return;
2456             }
2457 
2458             // DONE state
2459             me.readyState = FileReader.DONE;
2460 
2461             // null result
2462             me.result = null;
2463 
2464             // Save error
2465             me.error = new FileError(e);
2466 
2467             // If onerror callback
2468             if (typeof me.onerror === "function") {
2469                 me.onerror(new ProgressEvent("error", {target:me}));
2470             }
2471 
2472             // If onloadend callback
2473             if (typeof me.onloadend === "function") {
2474                 me.onloadend(new ProgressEvent("loadend", {target:me}));
2475             }
2476         }, "File", "readAsText", [this.fileName, enc]);

2610 var exec = require('cordova/exec');
2611 
2612 /**
2613  * FileTransfer uploads a file to a remote server.
2614  * @constructor
2615  */
2616 var FileTransfer = function() {};
2617 
2618 /**
2619 * Given an absolute file path, uploads a file on the device to a remote server
2620 * using a multipart HTTP request.
2621 * @param filePath {String}           Full path of the file on the device
2622 * @param server {String}             URL of the server to receive the file
2623 * @param successCallback (Function}  Callback to be invoked when upload has completed
2624 * @param errorCallback {Function}    Callback to be invoked upon error
2625 * @param options {FileUploadOptions} Optional parameters such as file name and mimetype
2626 * @param trustAllHosts {Boolean} Optional trust all hosts (e.g. for self-signed certs), defaults to false
2627 */
2628 FileTransfer.prototype.upload = function(filePath, server, successCallback, errorCallback, options, trustAllHosts) {
2629     // check for options
2630     var fileKey = null;
2631     var fileName = null;
2632     var mimeType = null;
2633     var params = null;
2634     var chunkedMode = true;
2635     if (options) {
2636         fileKey = options.fileKey;
2637         fileName = options.fileName;
2638         mimeType = options.mimeType;
2639         if (options.chunkedMode !== null || typeof options.chunkedMode != "undefined") {
2640             chunkedMode = options.chunkedMode;
2641         }
2642         if (options.params) {
2643             params = options.params;
2644         }
2645         else {
2646             params = {};
2647         }
2648     }
2649 
2650     exec(successCallback, errorCallback, 'FileTransfer', 'upload', [filePath, server, fileKey, fileName, mimeType, params, trustAllHosts, chunkedMode]);
2651 };
2652 
2653 /**
2654  * Downloads a file form a given URL and saves it to the specified directory.
2655  * @param source {String}          URL of the server to receive the file
2656  * @param target {String}         Full path of the file on the device
2657  * @param successCallback (Function}  Callback to be invoked when upload has completed
2658  * @param errorCallback {Function}    Callback to be invoked upon error
2659  */
2660 FileTransfer.prototype.download = function(source, target, successCallback, errorCallback) {
2661     var win = function(result) {
2662         var entry = null;
2663         if (result.isDirectory) {
2664             entry = new (require('cordova/plugin/DirectoryEntry'))();
2665         }
2666         else if (result.isFile) {
2667             entry = new (require('cordova/plugin/FileEntry'))();
2668         }
2669         entry.isDirectory = result.isDirectory;
2670         entry.isFile = result.isFile;
2671         entry.name = result.name;
2672         entry.fullPath = result.fullPath;
2673         successCallback(entry);
2674     };
2675     exec(win, errorCallback, 'FileTransfer', 'download', [source, target]);
2676 };
2677 
2678 module.exports = FileTransfer;
2679

2734 // file: lib/common/plugin/FileWriter.js
2735 define("cordova/plugin/FileWriter", function(require, exports, module) {
2736 var exec = require('cordova/exec'),
2737     FileError = require('cordova/plugin/FileError'),
2738     ProgressEvent = require('cordova/plugin/ProgressEvent');
2739 
2740 /**
2741  * This class writes to the mobile device file system.
2742  *
2743  * For Android:
2744  *      The root directory is the root of the file system.
2745  *      To write to the SD card, the file name is "sdcard/my_file.txt"
2746  *
2747  * @constructor
2748  * @param file {File} File object containing file properties
2749  * @param append if true write to the end of the file, otherwise overwrite the file
2750  */
2751 var FileWriter = function(file) {
2752     this.fileName = "";
2753     this.length = 0;
2754     if (file) {
2755         this.fileName = file.fullPath || file;
2756         this.length = file.size || 0;
2757     }
2758     // default is to write at the beginning of the file
2759     this.position = 0;
2760 
2761     this.readyState = 0; // EMPTY
2762 
2763     this.result = null;
2764 
2765     // Error
2766     this.error = null;
2767 
2768     // Event handlers
2769     this.onwritestart = null;   // When writing starts
2770     this.onprogress = null;     // While writing the file, and reporting partial file data
2771     this.onwrite = null;        // When the write has successfully completed.
2772     this.onwriteend = null;     // When the request has completed (either in success or failure).
2773     this.onabort = null;        // When the write has been aborted. For instance, by invoking the abort() method.
2774     this.onerror = null;        // When the write has failed (see errors).
2775 };
2776 
2777 // States
2778 FileWriter.INIT = 0;
2779 FileWriter.WRITING = 1;
2780 FileWriter.DONE = 2;
2781 
2782 /**
2783  * Abort writing file.
2784  */
2785 FileWriter.prototype.abort = function() {
2786     // check for invalid state
2787     if (this.readyState === FileWriter.DONE || this.readyState === FileWriter.INIT) {
2788         throw new FileError(FileError.INVALID_STATE_ERR);
2789     }
2790 
2791     // set error
2792     this.error = new FileError(FileError.ABORT_ERR);
2793 
2794     this.readyState = FileWriter.DONE;
2795 
2796     // If abort callback
2797     if (typeof this.onabort === "function") {
2798         this.onabort(new ProgressEvent("abort", {"target":this}));
2799     }
2800 
2801     // If write end callback
2802     if (typeof this.onwriteend === "function") {
2803         this.onwriteend(new ProgressEvent("writeend", {"target":this}));
2804     }
2805 };
2806 
2807 /**
2808  * Writes data to the file
2809  *
2810  * @param text to be written
2811  */
2812 FileWriter.prototype.write = function(text) {
2813     // Throw an exception if we are already writing a file
2814     if (this.readyState === FileWriter.WRITING) {
2815         throw new FileError(FileError.INVALID_STATE_ERR);
2816     }
2817 
2818     // WRITING state
2819     this.readyState = FileWriter.WRITING;
2820 
2821     var me = this;
2822 
2823     // If onwritestart callback
2824     if (typeof me.onwritestart === "function") {
2825         me.onwritestart(new ProgressEvent("writestart", {"target":me}));
2826     }
2827 
2828     // Write file
2829     exec(
2830         // Success callback
2831         function(r) {
2832             // If DONE (cancelled), then don't do anything
2833             if (me.readyState === FileWriter.DONE) {
2834                 return;
2835             }
2836 
2837             // position always increases by bytes written because file would be extended
2838             me.position += r;
2839             // The length of the file is now where we are done writing.
2840 
2841             me.length = me.position;
2842 
2843             // DONE state
2844             me.readyState = FileWriter.DONE;
2845 
2846             // If onwrite callback
2847             if (typeof me.onwrite === "function") {
2848                 me.onwrite(new ProgressEvent("write", {"target":me}));
2849             }
2850 
2851             // If onwriteend callback
2852             if (typeof me.onwriteend === "function") {
2853                 me.onwriteend(new ProgressEvent("writeend", {"target":me}));
2854             }
2855         },
2856         // Error callback
2857         function(e) {
2858             // If DONE (cancelled), then don't do anything
2859             if (me.readyState === FileWriter.DONE) {
2860                 return;
2861             }
2862 
2863             // DONE state
2864             me.readyState = FileWriter.DONE;
2865 
2866             // Save error
2867             me.error = new FileError(e);
2868 
2869             // If onerror callback
2870             if (typeof me.onerror === "function") {
2871                 me.onerror(new ProgressEvent("error", {"target":me}));
2872             }
2873 
2874             // If onwriteend callback
2875             if (typeof me.onwriteend === "function") {
2876                 me.onwriteend(new ProgressEvent("writeend", {"target":me}));
2877             }
2878         }, "File", "write", [this.fileName, text, this.position]);
2879 };
2880 
2881 /**
2882  * Moves the file pointer to the location specified.
2883  *
2884  * If the offset is a negative number the position of the file
2885  * pointer is rewound.  If the offset is greater than the file
2886  * size the position is set to the end of the file.
2887  *
2888  * @param offset is the location to move the file pointer to.
2889  */
2890 FileWriter.prototype.seek = function(offset) {
2891     // Throw an exception if we are already writing a file
2892     if (this.readyState === FileWriter.WRITING) {
2893         throw new FileError(FileError.INVALID_STATE_ERR);
2894     }
2895 
2896     if (!offset && offset !== 0) {
2897         return;
2898     }
2899 
2900     // See back from end of file.
2901     if (offset < 0) {
2902         this.position = Math.max(offset + this.length, 0);
2903     }
2904     // Offset is bigger then file size so set position
2905     // to the end of the file.
2906     else if (offset > this.length) {
2907         this.position = this.length;
2908     }
2909     // Offset is between 0 and file size so set the position
2910     // to start writing.
2911     else {
2912         this.position = offset;
2913     }
2914 };
2915 
2916 /**
2917  * Truncates the file to the size specified.
2918  *
2919  * @param size to chop the file at.
2920  */
2921 FileWriter.prototype.truncate = function(size) {
2922     // Throw an exception if we are already writing a file
2923     if (this.readyState === FileWriter.WRITING) {
2924         throw new FileError(FileError.INVALID_STATE_ERR);
2925     }
2926 
2927     // WRITING state
2928     this.readyState = FileWriter.WRITING;
2929 
2930     var me = this;
2931 
2932     // If onwritestart callback
2933     if (typeof me.onwritestart === "function") {
2934         me.onwritestart(new ProgressEvent("writestart", {"target":this}));
2935     }
2936 
2937     // Write file
2938     exec(
2939         // Success callback
2940         function(r) {
2941             // If DONE (cancelled), then don't do anything
2942             if (me.readyState === FileWriter.DONE) {
2943                 return;
2944             }
2945 
2946             // DONE state
2947             me.readyState = FileWriter.DONE;
2948 
2949             // Update the length of the file
2950             me.length = r;
2951             me.position = Math.min(me.position, r);
2952 
2953             // If onwrite callback
2954             if (typeof me.onwrite === "function") {
2955                 me.onwrite(new ProgressEvent("write", {"target":me}));
2956             }
2957 
2958             // If onwriteend callback
2959             if (typeof me.onwriteend === "function") {
2960                 me.onwriteend(new ProgressEvent("writeend", {"target":me}));
2961             }
2962         },
2963         // Error callback
2964         function(e) {
2965             // If DONE (cancelled), then don't do anything
2966             if (me.readyState === FileWriter.DONE) {
2967                 return;
2968             }
2969 
2970             // DONE state
2971             me.readyState = FileWriter.DONE;
2972 
2973             // Save error
2974             me.error = new FileError(e);
2975 
2976             // If onerror callback
2977             if (typeof me.onerror === "function") {
2978                 me.onerror(new ProgressEvent("error", {"target":me}));
2979             }
2980 
2981             // If onwriteend callback
2982             if (typeof me.onwriteend === "function") {
2983                 me.onwriteend(new ProgressEvent("writeend", {"target":me}));
2984             }
2985         }, "File", "truncate", [this.fileName, size]);
2986 };
2987 
2988 module.exports = FileWriter;
2989 
2990 });

3424 // file: lib/common/plugin/accelerometer.js
3425 define("cordova/plugin/accelerometer", function(require, exports, module) {
3426 /**
3427  * This class provides access to device accelerometer data.
3428  * @constructor
3429  */
3430 var utils = require("cordova/utils"),
3431     exec = require("cordova/exec"),
3432     Acceleration = require('cordova/plugin/Acceleration');
3433 
3434 // Is the accel sensor running?
3435 var running = false;
3436 
3437 // Keeps reference to watchAcceleration calls.
3438 var timers = {};
3439 
3440 // Array of listeners; used to keep track of when we should call start and stop.
3441 var listeners = [];
3442 
3443 // Last returned acceleration object from native
3444 var accel = null;
3445 
3446 // Tells native to start.
3447 function start() {
3448     exec(function(a) {
3449         var tempListeners = listeners.slice(0);
3450         accel = new Acceleration(a.x, a.y, a.z, a.timestamp);
3451         for (var i = 0, l = tempListeners.length; i < l; i++) {
3452             tempListeners[i].win(accel);
3453         }
3454     }, function(e) {
3455         var tempListeners = listeners.slice(0);
3456         for (var i = 0, l = tempListeners.length; i < l; i++) {
3457             tempListeners[i].fail(e);
3458         }
3459     }, "Accelerometer", "start", []);
3460     running = true;
3461 }
3462 
3463 // Tells native to stop.
3464 function stop() {
3465     exec(null, null, "Accelerometer", "stop", []);
3466     running = false;
3467 }
3468 
3469 // Adds a callback pair to the listeners array
3470 function createCallbackPair(win, fail) {
3471     return {win:win, fail:fail};
3472 }
3473 
3474 // Removes a win/fail listener pair from the listeners array
3475 function removeListeners(l) {
3476     var idx = listeners.indexOf(l);
3477     if (idx > -1) {
3478         listeners.splice(idx, 1);
3479         if (listeners.length === 0) {
3480             stop();
3481         }
3482     }
3483 }
3484 
3485 var accelerometer = {
3486     /**
3487      * Asynchronously aquires the current acceleration.
3488      *
3489      * @param {Function} successCallback    The function to call when the acceleration data is available
3490      * @param {Function} errorCallback      The function to call when there is an error getting the acceleration data. (OPTIONAL)
3491      * @param {AccelerationOptions} options The options for getting the accelerometer data such as timeout. (OPTIONAL)
3492      */
3493     getCurrentAcceleration: function(successCallback, errorCallback, options) {
3494         // successCallback required
3495         if (typeof successCallback !== "function") {
3496             throw "getCurrentAcceleration must be called with at least a success callback function as first parameter.";
3497         }
3498 
3499         var p;
3500         var win = function(a) {
3501             successCallback(a);
3502             removeListeners(p);
3503         };
3504         var fail = function(e) {
3505             errorCallback(e);
3506             removeListeners(p);
3507         };
3508 
3509         p = createCallbackPair(win, fail);
3510         listeners.push(p);
3511 
3512         if (!running) {
3513             start();
3514         }
3515     },
3516 
3517     /**
3518      * Asynchronously aquires the acceleration repeatedly at a given interval.
3519      *
3520      * @param {Function} successCallback    The function to call each time the acceleration data is available
3521      * @param {Function} errorCallback      The function to call when there is an error getting the acceleration data. (OPTIONAL)
3522      * @param {AccelerationOptions} options The options for getting the accelerometer data such as timeout. (OPTIONAL)
3523      * @return String                       The watch id that must be passed to #clearWatch to stop watching.
3524      */
3525     watchAcceleration: function(successCallback, errorCallback, options) {
3526         // Default interval (10 sec)
3527         var frequency = (options && options.frequency && typeof options.frequency == 'number') ? options.frequency : 10000;
3528 
3529         // successCallback required
3530         if (typeof successCallback !== "function") {
3531             throw "watchAcceleration must be called with at least a success callback function as first parameter.";
3532         }
3533 
3534         // Keep reference to watch id, and report accel readings as often as defined in frequency
3535         var id = utils.createUUID();
3536 
3537         var p = createCallbackPair(function(){}, function(e) {
3538             errorCallback(e);
3539             removeListeners(p);
3540         });
3541         listeners.push(p);
3542 
3543         timers[id] = {
3544             timer:window.setInterval(function() {
3545                 if (accel) {
3546                     successCallback(accel);
3547                 }
3548             }, frequency),
3549             listeners:p
3550         };
3551 
3552         if (running) {
3553             // If we're already running then immediately invoke the success callback
3554             successCallback(accel);
3555         } else {
3556             start();
3557         }
3558 
3559         return id;
3560     },
3561 
3562     /**
3563      * Clears the specified accelerometer watch.
3564      *
3565      * @param {String} id       The id of the watch returned from #watchAcceleration.
3566      */
3567     clearWatch: function(id) {
3568         // Stop javascript timer & remove from timer list
3569         if (id && timers[id]) {
3570             window.clearInterval(timers[id].timer);

3656 // file: lib/android/plugin/android/callback.js
3657 define("cordova/plugin/android/callback", function(require, exports, module) {
3658 var port = null,
3659     token = null,
3660     cordova = require('cordova'),
3661     polling = require('cordova/plugin/android/polling'),
3662     callback = function() {
3663       // Exit if shutting down app
3664       if (cordova.shuttingDown) {
3665           return;
3666       }
3667 
3668       // If polling flag was changed, start using polling from now on
3669       if (cordova.UsePolling) {
3670           polling();
3671           return;
3672       }
3673 
3674       var xmlhttp = new XMLHttpRequest();
3675 
3676       // Callback function when XMLHttpRequest is ready
3677       xmlhttp.onreadystatechange=function(){
3678           if(xmlhttp.readyState === 4){
3679 
3680               // Exit if shutting down app
3681               if (cordova.shuttingDown) {
3682                   return;
3683               }
3684 
3685               // If callback has JavaScript statement to execute
3686               if (xmlhttp.status === 200) {
3687 
3688                   // Need to url decode the response
3689                   var msg = decodeURIComponent(xmlhttp.responseText);
3690                   setTimeout(function() {
3691                       try {
3692                           var t = eval(msg);
3693                       }
3694                       catch (e) {
3695                           // If we're getting an error here, seeing the message will help in debugging
3696                           console.log("JSCallback: Message from Server: " + msg);
3697                           console.log("JSCallback Error: "+e);
3698                       }
3699                   }, 1);
3700                   setTimeout(callback, 1);
3701               }
3702 
3703               // If callback ping (used to keep XHR request from timing out)
3704               else if (xmlhttp.status === 404) {
3705                   setTimeout(callback, 10);
3706               }
3707 
3708               // If security error
3709               else if (xmlhttp.status === 403) {
3710                   console.log("JSCallback Error: Invalid token.  Stopping callbacks.");
3711               }
3712 
3713               // If server is stopping
3714               else if (xmlhttp.status === 503) {
3715                   console.log("JSCallback Server Closed: Stopping callbacks.");
3716               }
3717 
3718               // If request wasn't GET
3719               else if (xmlhttp.status === 400) {
3720                   console.log("JSCallback Error: Bad request.  Stopping callbacks.");
3721               }
3722 
3723               // If error, revert to polling
3724               else {
3725                   console.log("JSCallback Error: Request failed.");
3726                   cordova.UsePolling = true;
3727                   polling();
3728               }
3729           }
3730       };
3731 
3732       if (port === null) {
3733           port = prompt("getPort", "gap_callbackServer:");
3734       }
3735       if (token === null) {
3736           token = prompt("getToken", "gap_callbackServer:");
3737       }
3738       xmlhttp.open("GET", "http://127.0.0.1:"+port+"/"+token , true);
3739       xmlhttp.send();
3740 };
3741 
3742 module.exports = callback;
3743 });
3744

3936 // file: lib/android/plugin/android/storage.js
3937 define("cordova/plugin/android/storage", function(require, exports, module) {
3938 var utils = require('cordova/utils'),
3939     exec = require('cordova/exec'),
3940     channel = require('cordova/channel');
3941 
3942 var queryQueue = {};
3943 
3944 /**
3945  * SQL result set object
3946  * PRIVATE METHOD
3947  * @constructor
3948  */
3949 var DroidDB_Rows = function() {
3950     this.resultSet = [];    // results array
3951     this.length = 0;        // number of rows
3952 };
3953 
3954 /**
3955  * Get item from SQL result set
3956  *
3957  * @param row           The row number to return
3958  * @return              The row object
3959  */
3960 DroidDB_Rows.prototype.item = function(row) {
3961     return this.resultSet[row];
3962 };
3963 
3964 /**
3965  * SQL result set that is returned to user.
3966  * PRIVATE METHOD
3967  * @constructor
3968  */
3969 var DroidDB_Result = function() {
3970     this.rows = new DroidDB_Rows();
3971 };
3972 
3973 /**
3974  * Callback from native code when query is complete.
3975  * PRIVATE METHOD
3976  *
3977  * @param id   Query id
3978  */
3979 function completeQuery(id, data) {
3980     var query = queryQueue[id];
3981     if (query) {
3982         try {
3983             delete queryQueue[id];
3984 
3985             // Get transaction
3986             var tx = query.tx;
3987 
3988             // If transaction hasn't failed
3989             // Note: We ignore all query results if previous query
3990             //       in the same transaction failed.
3991             if (tx && tx.queryList[id]) {
3992 
3993                 // Save query results
3994                 var r = new DroidDB_Result();
3995                 r.rows.resultSet = data;
3996                 r.rows.length = data.length;
3997                 try {
3998                     if (typeof query.successCallback === 'function') {
3999                         query.successCallback(query.tx, r);
4000                     }
4001                 } catch (ex) {
4002                     console.log("executeSql error calling user success callback: "+ex);
4003                 }
4004 
4005                 tx.queryComplete(id);
4006             }
4007         } catch (e) {
4008             console.log("executeSql error: "+e);
4009         }
4010     }
4011 }
4012 
4013 /**
4014  * Callback from native code when query fails
4015  * PRIVATE METHOD
4016  *
4017  * @param reason            Error message
4018  * @param id                Query id
4019  */
4020 function failQuery(reason, id) {
4021     var query = queryQueue[id];
4022     if (query) {
4023         try {
4024             delete queryQueue[id];
4025 
4026             // Get transaction
4027             var tx = query.tx;
4028 
4029             // If transaction hasn't failed
4030             // Note: We ignore all query results if previous query
4031             //       in the same transaction failed.
4032             if (tx && tx.queryList[id]) {
4033                 tx.queryList = {};
4034 
4035                 try {
4036                     if (typeof query.errorCallback === 'function') {
4037                         query.errorCallback(query.tx, reason);
4038                     }
4039                 } catch (ex) {
4040                     console.log("executeSql error calling user error callback: "+ex);
4041                 }
4042 
4043                 tx.queryFailed(id, reason);
4044             }
4045 
4046         } catch (e) {
4047             console.log("executeSql error: "+e);
4048         }
4049     }
4050 }
4051 
4052 /**
4053  * SQL query object
4054  * PRIVATE METHOD
4055  *
4056  * @constructor
4057  * @param tx                The transaction object that this query belongs to
4058  */
4059 var DroidDB_Query = function(tx) {
4060 
4061     // Set the id of the query
4062     this.id = utils.createUUID();
4063 
4064     // Add this query to the queue
4065     queryQueue[this.id] = this;
4066 
4067     // Init result
4068     this.resultSet = [];
4069 
4070     // Set transaction that this query belongs to
4071     this.tx = tx;
4072 
4073     // Add this query to transaction list
4074     this.tx.queryList[this.id] = this;
4075 
4076     // Callbacks
4077     this.successCallback = null;
4078     this.errorCallback = null;
4079 
4080 };
4081 
4082 /**
4083  * Transaction object
4084  * PRIVATE METHOD
4085  * @constructor
4086  */
4087 var DroidDB_Tx = function() {
4088 
4089     // Set the id of the transaction
4090     this.id = utils.createUUID();
4091 
4092     // Callbacks
4093     this.successCallback = null;
4094     this.errorCallback = null;
4095 
4096     // Query list
4097     this.queryList = {};
4098 };
4099 
4100 /**
4101  * Mark query in transaction as complete.
4102  * If all queries are complete, call the user's transaction success callback.
4103  *
4104  * @param id                Query id
4105  */
4106 DroidDB_Tx.prototype.queryComplete = function(id) {
4107     delete this.queryList[id];
4108 
4109     // If no more outstanding queries, then fire transaction success
4110     if (this.successCallback) {
4111         var count = 0;
4112         var i;
4113         for (i in this.queryList) {
4114             if (this.queryList.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
4115                 count++;
4116             }
4117         }
4118         if (count === 0) {
4119             try {
4120                 this.successCallback();
4121             } catch(e) {
4122                 console.log("Transaction error calling user success callback: " + e);
4123             }
4124         }
4125     }
4126 };
4127 
4128 /**
4129  * Mark query in transaction as failed.
4130  *
4131  * @param id                Query id
4132  * @param reason            Error message
4133  */
4134 DroidDB_Tx.prototype.queryFailed = function(id, reason) {
4135 
4136     // The sql queries in this transaction have already been run, since
4137     // we really don't have a real transaction implemented in native code.
4138     // However, the user callbacks for the remaining sql queries in transaction
4139     // will not be called.
4140     this.queryList = {};
4141 
4142     if (this.errorCallback) {
4143         try {
4144             this.errorCallback(reason);
4145         } catch(e) {
4146             console.log("Transaction error calling user error callback: " + e);
4147         }
4148     }
4149 };
4150 
4151 /**
4152  * Execute SQL statement
4153  *
4154  * @param sql                   SQL statement to execute
4155  * @param params                Statement parameters
4156  * @param successCallback       Success callback
4157  * @param errorCallback         Error callback
4158  */
4159 DroidDB_Tx.prototype.executeSql = function(sql, params, successCallback, errorCallback) {
4160 
4161     // Init params array
4162     if (typeof params === 'undefined') {
4163         params = [];
4164     }
4165 
4166     // Create query and add to queue
4167     var query = new DroidDB_Query(this);
4168     queryQueue[query.id] = query;
4169 
4170     // Save callbacks
4171     query.successCallback = successCallback;
4172     query.errorCallback = errorCallback;
4173 
4174     // Call native code
4175     exec(null, null, "Storage", "executeSql", [sql, params, query.id]);
4176 };

4178 var DatabaseShell = function() {
4179 };
4180 
4181 /**
4182  * Start a transaction.
4183  * Does not support rollback in event of failure.
4184  *
4185  * @param process {Function}            The transaction function
4186  * @param successCallback {Function}
4187  * @param errorCallback {Function}
4188  */
4189 DatabaseShell.prototype.transaction = function(process, errorCallback, successCallback) {
4190     var tx = new DroidDB_Tx();
4191     tx.successCallback = successCallback;
4192     tx.errorCallback = errorCallback;
4193     try {
4194         process(tx);
4195     } catch (e) {
4196         console.log("Transaction error: "+e);
4197         if (tx.errorCallback) {
4198             try {
4199                 tx.errorCallback(e);
4200             } catch (ex) {
4201                 console.log("Transaction error calling user error callback: "+e);
4202             }
4203         }
4204     }
4205 };

4207 /**
4208  * Open database
4209  *
4210  * @param name              Database name

4214  * @return                  Database object

4216 var DroidDB_openDatabase = function(name, version, display_name, size) {

4222 /**
4223  * For browsers with no localStorage we emulate it with SQLite. Follows the w3c api.
4224  * TODO: Do similar for sessionStorage.
4225  * @constructor
4226  */
4227 var CupcakeLocalStorage = function() {
4228     channel.waitForInitialization("cupcakeStorage");
4229 
4230     try {
4231 
4232       this.db = openDatabase('localStorage', '1.0', 'localStorage', 2621440);
4233       var storage = {};
4234       this.length = 0;
4235       function setLength (length) {
4236         this.length = length;
4237         localStorage.length = length;
4238       }
4239       this.db.transaction(
4240         function (transaction) {
4241             var i;
4242           transaction.executeSql('CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS storage (id NVARCHAR(40) PRIMARY KEY, body NVARCHAR(255))');
4243           transaction.executeSql('SELECT * FROM storage', [], function(tx, result) {
4244             for(var i = 0; i < result.rows.length; i++) {
4245               storage[result.rows.item(i).id] =  result.rows.item(i).body;
4246             }
4247             setLength(result.rows.length);
4248             channel.initializationComplete("cupcakeStorage");
4249           });
4250 
4251         },
4252         function (err) {
4253           utils.alert(err.message);
4254         }
4255       );
4256       this.setItem = function(key, val) {
4257         if (typeof(storage[key])=='undefined') {
4258           this.length++;
4259         }
4260         storage[key] = val;
4261         this.db.transaction(
4262           function (transaction) {
4263             transaction.executeSql('CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS storage (id NVARCHAR(40) PRIMARY KEY, body NVARCHAR(255))');
4264             transaction.executeSql('REPLACE INTO storage (id, body) values(?,?)', [key,val]);
4265           }
4266         );
4267       };
4268       this.getItem = function(key) {
4269         return storage[key];
4270       };
4271       this.removeItem = function(key) {
4272         delete storage[key];
4273         this.length--;
4274         this.db.transaction(
4275           function (transaction) {
4276             transaction.executeSql('CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS storage (id NVARCHAR(40) PRIMARY KEY, body NVARCHAR(255))');
4277             transaction.executeSql('DELETE FROM storage where id=?', [key]);
4278           }
4279         );
4280       };
4281       this.clear = function() {
4282         storage = {};
4283         this.length = 0;
4284         this.db.transaction(
4285           function (transaction) {
4286             transaction.executeSql('CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS storage (id NVARCHAR(40) PRIMARY KEY, body NVARCHAR(255))');
4287             transaction.executeSql('DELETE FROM storage', []);
4288           }
4289         );
4290       };
4291       this.key = function(index) {
4292         var i = 0;
4293         for (var j in storage) {
4294           if (i==index) {
4295             return j;
4296           } else {
4297             i++;
4298           }
4299         }
4300         return null;
4301       };
4302 
4303     } catch(e) {
4304           utils.alert("Database error "+e+".");
4305         return;
4306     }
4307 };
