4327 function handlers() {
4328   return battery.channels.batterystatus.numHandlers +
4329          battery.channels.batterylow.numHandlers +
4330          battery.channels.batterycritical.numHandlers;
4331 }
4332 
4333 var Battery = function() {
4334     this._level = null;
4335     this._isPlugged = null;
4336     // Create new event handlers on the window (returns a channel instance)
4337     var subscriptionEvents = {
4338       onSubscribe:this.onSubscribe,
4339       onUnsubscribe:this.onUnsubscribe
4340     };
4341     this.channels = {
4342       batterystatus:cordova.addWindowEventHandler("batterystatus", subscriptionEvents),
4343       batterylow:cordova.addWindowEventHandler("batterylow", subscriptionEvents),
4344       batterycritical:cordova.addWindowEventHandler("batterycritical", subscriptionEvents)
4345     };
4346 };
4347 /**
4348  * Event handlers for when callbacks get registered for the battery.
4349  * Keep track of how many handlers we have so we can start and stop the native battery listener
4350  * appropriately (and hopefully save on battery life!).
4351  */
4352 Battery.prototype.onSubscribe = function() {
4353   var me = battery;
4354   // If we just registered the first handler, make sure native listener is started.
4355   if (handlers() === 1) {
4356     exec(me._status, me._error, "Battery", "start", []);
4357   }
4358 };
4359 
4360 Battery.prototype.onUnsubscribe = function() {
4361   var me = battery;
4362 
4363   // If we just unregistered the last handler, make sure native listener is stopped.
4364   if (handlers() === 0) {
4365       exec(null, null, "Battery", "stop", []);
4366   }
4367 };
4368 
4369 /**
4370  * Callback for battery status
4371  *
4372  * @param {Object} info            keys: level, isPlugged
4373  */
4374 Battery.prototype._status = function(info) {
4375     if (info) {
4376         var me = battery;
4377     var level = info.level;
4378         if (me._level !== level || me._isPlugged !== info.isPlugged) {
4379             // Fire batterystatus event
4380             cordova.fireWindowEvent("batterystatus", info);
4381 
4382             // Fire low battery event
4383             if (level === 20 || level === 5) {
4384                 if (level === 20) {
4385                     cordova.fireWindowEvent("batterylow", info);
4386                 }
4387                 else {
4388                     cordova.fireWindowEvent("batterycritical", info);
4389                 }
4390             }
4391         }
4392         me._level = level;
4393         me._isPlugged = info.isPlugged;
4394     }
4395 };
4396 
4397 /**
4398  * Error callback for battery start
4399  */
4400 Battery.prototype._error = function(e) {
4401     console.log("Error initializing Battery: " + e);
4402 };
4403 
4404 var battery = new Battery();
4405

4486 // file: lib/common/plugin/compass.js
4487 define("cordova/plugin/compass", function(require, exports, module) {
4488 var exec = require('cordova/exec'),
4489     utils = require('cordova/utils'),
4490     CompassHeading = require('cordova/plugin/CompassHeading'),
4491     CompassError = require('cordova/plugin/CompassError'),
4492     timers = {},
4493     compass = {
4494         /**
4495          * Asynchronously acquires the current heading.
4496          * @param {Function} successCallback The function to call when the heading
4497          * data is available
4498          * @param {Function} errorCallback The function to call when there is an error
4499          * getting the heading data.
4500          * @param {CompassOptions} options The options for getting the heading data (not used).
4501          */
4502         getCurrentHeading:function(successCallback, errorCallback, options) {
4503             // successCallback required
4504             if (typeof successCallback !== "function") {
4505               console.log("Compass Error: successCallback is not a function");
4506               return;
4507             }
4508 
4509             // errorCallback optional
4510             if (errorCallback && (typeof errorCallback !== "function")) {
4511               console.log("Compass Error: errorCallback is not a function");
4512               return;
4513             }
4514 
4515             var win = function(result) {
4516                 var ch = new CompassHeading(result.magneticHeading, result.trueHeading, result.headingAccuracy, result.timestamp);
4517                 successCallback(ch);
4518             };
4519             var fail = function(code) {
4520                 var ce = new CompassError(code);
4521                 errorCallback(ce);
4522             };
4523 
4524             // Get heading
4525             exec(win, fail, "Compass", "getHeading", [options]);
4526         },
4527 
4528         /**
4529          * Asynchronously acquires the heading repeatedly at a given interval.
4530          * @param {Function} successCallback The function to call each time the heading
4531          * data is available
4532          * @param {Function} errorCallback The function to call when there is an error
4533          * getting the heading data.
4534          * @param {HeadingOptions} options The options for getting the heading data
4535          * such as timeout and the frequency of the watch. For iOS, filter parameter
4536          * specifies to watch via a distance filter rather than time.
4537          */
4538         watchHeading:function(successCallback, errorCallback, options) {
4539             // Default interval (100 msec)
4540             var frequency = (options !== undefined && options.frequency !== undefined) ? options.frequency : 100;
4541             var filter = (options !== undefined && options.filter !== undefined) ? options.filter : 0;
4542 
4543             // successCallback required
4544             if (typeof successCallback !== "function") {
4545               console.log("Compass Error: successCallback is not a function");
4546               return;
4547             }
4548 
4549             // errorCallback optional
4550             if (errorCallback && (typeof errorCallback !== "function")) {
4551               console.log("Compass Error: errorCallback is not a function");
4552               return;
4553             }
4554 
4555             var id = utils.createUUID();
4556             if (filter > 0) {
4557                 // is an iOS request for watch by filter, no timer needed
4558                 timers[id] = "iOS";
4559                 compass.getCurrentHeading(successCallback, errorCallback, options);
4560             } else {
4561                 // Start watch timer to get headings
4562                 timers[id] = window.setInterval(function() {
4563                     compass.getCurrentHeading(successCallback, errorCallback);
4564                 }, frequency);
4565             }
4566 
4567             return id;
4568         },
4569 
4570         /**
4571          * Clears the specified heading watch.
4572          * @param {String} watchId The ID of the watch returned from #watchHeading.
4573          */
4574         clearWatch:function(id) {
4575             // Stop javascript timer & remove from timer list
4576             if (id && timers[id]) {
4577                 if (timers[id] != "iOS") {
4578                       clearInterval(timers[id]);
4579                   } else {
4580                     // is iOS watch by filter so call into device to stop
4581                     exec(null, null, "Compass", "stopHeading", []);
4582                 }
4583                 delete timers[id];
4584             }
4585         }
4586     };
4587 
4588 module.exports = compass;
4589 });

4738 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4739 // return a new function that calls both functions passed as args
4740 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4741 function wrapperedOrigCall(orgFunc, newFunc) {
4742     return function() {
4743         var args = [].slice.call(arguments);
4744         try { orgFunc.apply(WinConsole, args); } catch (e) {}
4745         try { newFunc.apply(console,    args); } catch (e) {}
4746     };
4747 }
4748 
4749 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4750 // For every function that exists in the original console object, that
4751 // also exists in the new console object, wrap the new console method
4752 // with one that calls both
4753 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4754 for (var key in console) {
4755     if (typeof WinConsole[key] == "function") {
4756         console[key] = wrapperedOrigCall(WinConsole[key], console[key]);
4757     }
4758 }

4782     find:function(fields, successCB, errorCB, options) {

4825 // file: lib/common/plugin/geolocation.js
4826 define("cordova/plugin/geolocation", function(require, exports, module) {
4827 var utils = require('cordova/utils'),
4828     exec = require('cordova/exec'),
4829     PositionError = require('cordova/plugin/PositionError'),
4830     Position = require('cordova/plugin/Position');
4831 
4832 var timers = {};   // list of timers in use
4833 
4834 // Returns default params, overrides if provided with values
4835 function parseParameters(options) {
4836     var opt = {
4837         maximumAge: 0,
4838         enableHighAccuracy: false,
4839         timeout: Infinity
4840     };
4841 
4842     if (options) {
4843         if (options.maximumAge !== undefined && !isNaN(options.maximumAge) && options.maximumAge > 0) {
4844             opt.maximumAge = options.maximumAge;
4845         }
4846         if (options.enableHighAccuracy !== undefined) {
4847             opt.enableHighAccuracy = options.enableHighAccuracy;
4848         }
4849         if (options.timeout !== undefined && !isNaN(options.timeout)) {
4850             if (options.timeout < 0) {
4851                 opt.timeout = 0;
4852             } else {
4853                 opt.timeout = options.timeout;
4854             }
4855         }
4856     }
4857 
4858     return opt;
4859 }
4860 
4861 // Returns a timeout failure, closed over a specified timeout value and error callback.
4862 function createTimeout(errorCallback, timeout) {
4863     var t = setTimeout(function() {
4864         clearTimeout(t);
4865         t = null;
4866         errorCallback({
4867             code:PositionError.TIMEOUT,
4868             message:"Position retrieval timed out."
4869         });
4870     }, timeout);
4871     return t;
4872 }
4873 
4874 var geolocation = {
4875     lastPosition:null, // reference to last known (cached) position returned
4876     /**
4877    * Asynchronously aquires the current position.
4878    *
4879    * @param {Function} successCallback    The function to call when the position data is available
4880    * @param {Function} errorCallback      The function to call when there is an error getting the heading position. (OPTIONAL)
4881    * @param {PositionOptions} options     The options for getting the position data. (OPTIONAL)
4882    */
4883     getCurrentPosition:function(successCallback, errorCallback, options) {
4884         if (arguments.length === 0) {
4885             throw new Error("getCurrentPosition must be called with at least one argument.");
4886         }
4887         options = parseParameters(options);
4888 
4889         // Timer var that will fire an error callback if no position is retrieved from native
4890         // before the "timeout" param provided expires
4891         var timeoutTimer = null;
4892 
4893         var win = function(p) {
4894             clearTimeout(timeoutTimer);
4895             if (!timeoutTimer) {
4896                 // Timeout already happened, or native fired error callback for
4897                 // this geo request.
4898                 // Don't continue with success callback.
4899                 return;
4900             }
4901             var pos = new Position(
4902                 {
4903                     latitude:p.latitude,
4904                     longitude:p.longitude,
4905                     altitude:p.altitude,
4906                     accuracy:p.accuracy,
4907                     heading:p.heading,
4908                     velocity:p.velocity,
4909                     altitudeAccuracy:p.altitudeAccuracy
4910                 },
4911                 (p.timestamp === undefined ? new Date() : ((p.timestamp instanceof Date) ? p.timestamp : new Date(p.timestamp)))
4912             );
4913             geolocation.lastPosition = pos;
4914             successCallback(pos);
4915         };
4916         var fail = function(e) {
4917             clearTimeout(timeoutTimer);
4918             timeoutTimer = null;
4919             var err = new PositionError(e.code, e.message);
4920             if (errorCallback) {
4921                 errorCallback(err);
4922             }
4923         };
4924 
4925         // Check our cached position, if its timestamp difference with current time is less than the maximumAge, then just
4926         // fire the success callback with the cached position.
4927         if (geolocation.lastPosition && options.maximumAge && (((new Date()).getTime() - geolocation.lastPosition.timestamp.getTime()) <= options.maximumAge)) {
4928             successCallback(geolocation.lastPosition);
4929         // If the cached position check failed and the timeout was set to 0, error out with a TIMEOUT error object.
4930         } else if (options.timeout === 0) {
4931             fail({
4932                 code:PositionError.TIMEOUT,
4933                 message:"timeout value in PositionOptions set to 0 and no cached Position object available, or cached Position object's age exceed's provided PositionOptions' maximumAge parameter."
4934             });
4935         // Otherwise we have to call into native to retrieve a position.
4936         } else {
4937             if (options.timeout !== Infinity) {
4938                 // If the timeout value was not set to Infinity (default), then
4939                 // set up a timeout function that will fire the error callback
4940                 // if no successful position was retrieved before timeout expired.
4941                 timeoutTimer = createTimeout(fail, options.timeout);
4942             } else {
4943                 // This is here so the check in the win function doesn't mess stuff up
4944                 // may seem weird but this guarantees timeoutTimer is
4945                 // always truthy before we call into native
4946                 timeoutTimer = true;
4947             }
4948             exec(win, fail, "Geolocation", "getLocation", [options.enableHighAccuracy, options.maximumAge]);
4949         }
4950         return timeoutTimer;
4951     },
4952     /**
4953      * Asynchronously watches the geolocation for changes to geolocation.  When a change occurs,
4954      * the successCallback is called with the new location.
4955      *
4956      * @param {Function} successCallback    The function to call each time the location data is available
4957      * @param {Function} errorCallback      The function to call when there is an error getting the location data. (OPTIONAL)
4958      * @param {PositionOptions} options     The options for getting the location data such as frequency. (OPTIONAL)
4959      * @return String                       The watch id that must be passed to #clearWatch to stop watching.
4960      */
4961     watchPosition:function(successCallback, errorCallback, options) {
4962         if (arguments.length === 0) {
4963             throw new Error("watchPosition must be called with at least one argument.");
4964         }
4965         options = parseParameters(options);
4966 
4967         var id = utils.createUUID();
4968 
4969         // Tell device to get a position ASAP, and also retrieve a reference to the timeout timer generated in getCurrentPosition
4970         timers[id] = geolocation.getCurrentPosition(successCallback, errorCallback, options);
4971 
4972         var fail = function(e) {
4973             clearTimeout(timers[id]);
4974             var err = new PositionError(e.code, e.message);
4975             if (errorCallback) {
4976                 errorCallback(err);
4977             }
4978         };
4979 
4980         var win = function(p) {
4981             clearTimeout(timers[id]);
4982             if (options.timeout !== Infinity) {
4983                 timers[id] = createTimeout(fail, options.timeout);
4984             }
4985             var pos = new Position(
4986                 {
4987                     latitude:p.latitude,
4988                     longitude:p.longitude,
4989                     altitude:p.altitude,
4990                     accuracy:p.accuracy,
4991                     heading:p.heading,
4992                     velocity:p.velocity,
4993                     altitudeAccuracy:p.altitudeAccuracy
4994                 },
4995                 (p.timestamp === undefined ? new Date() : ((p.timestamp instanceof Date) ? p.timestamp : new Date(p.timestamp)))
4996             );
4997             geolocation.lastPosition = pos;
4998             successCallback(pos);
4999         };
5000 
5001         exec(win, fail, "Geolocation", "addWatch", [id, options.enableHighAccuracy]);
5002 
5003         return id;
5004     },
5005     /**
5006      * Clears the specified heading watch.
5007      *
5008      * @param {String} id       The ID of the watch returned from #watchPosition
5009      */
5010     clearWatch:function(id) {
5011         if (id && timers[id] !== undefined) {
5012             clearTimeout(timers[id]);
5013             delete timers[id];
5014             exec(null, null, "Geolocation", "clearWatch", [id]);
5015         }
5016     }
5017 };
5018 
5019 module.exports = geolocation;
5020 
5021 });

5023 // file: lib/common/plugin/logger.js
5024 define("cordova/plugin/logger", function(require, exports, module) {
5025 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5026 // The logger module exports the following properties/functions:
5027 //
5028 // LOG                          - constant for the level LOG
5029 // ERROR                        - constant for the level ERROR
5030 // WARN                         - constant for the level WARN
5031 // INFO                         - constant for the level INFO
5032 // DEBUG                        - constant for the level DEBUG
5033 // logLevel()                   - returns current log level
5034 // logLevel(value)              - sets and returns a new log level
5035 // useConsole()                 - returns whether logger is using console
5036 // useConsole(value)            - sets and returns whether logger is using console
5037 // log(message,...)             - logs a message at level LOG
5038 // error(message,...)           - logs a message at level ERROR
5039 // warn(message,...)            - logs a message at level WARN
5040 // info(message,...)            - logs a message at level INFO
5041 // debug(message,...)           - logs a message at level DEBUG
5042 // logLevel(level,message,...)  - logs a message specified level
5043 //
5044 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5045 
5046 var logger = exports;
5047 
5048 var exec    = require('cordova/exec');
5049 var utils   = require('cordova/utils');
5050 
5051 var UseConsole   = true;
5052 var Queued       = [];
5053 var DeviceReady  = false;
5054 var CurrentLevel;
5055 
5056 /**
5057  * Logging levels
5058  */
5059 
5060 var Levels = [
5061     "LOG",
5062     "ERROR",
5063     "WARN",
5064     "INFO",
5065     "DEBUG"
5066 ];
5067 
5068 /*
5069  * add the logging levels to the logger object and
5070  * to a separate levelsMap object for testing
5071  */
5072 
5073 var LevelsMap = {};
5074 for (var i=0; i<Levels.length; i++) {
5075     var level = Levels[i];
5076     LevelsMap[level] = i;
5077     logger[level]    = level;
5078 }
5079 
5080 CurrentLevel = LevelsMap.WARN;
5081 
5082 /**
5083  * Getter/Setter for the logging level
5084  *
5085  * Returns the current logging level.
5086  *
5087  * When a value is passed, sets the logging level to that value.
5088  * The values should be one of the following constants:
5089  *    logger.LOG
5090  *    logger.ERROR
5091  *    logger.WARN
5092  *    logger.INFO
5093  *    logger.DEBUG
5094  *
5095  * The value used determines which messages get printed.  The logging
5096  * values above are in order, and only messages logged at the logging
5097  * level or above will actually be displayed to the user.  Eg, the
5098  * default level is WARN, so only messages logged with LOG, ERROR, or
5099  * WARN will be displayed; INFO and DEBUG messages will be ignored.
5100  */
5101 logger.level = function (value) {
5102     if (arguments.length) {
5103         if (LevelsMap[value] === null) {
5104             throw new Error("invalid logging level: " + value);
5105         }
5106         CurrentLevel = LevelsMap[value];
5107     }
5108 
5109     return Levels[CurrentLevel];
5110 };
5111 
5112 /**
5113  * Getter/Setter for the useConsole functionality
5114  *
5115  * When useConsole is true, the logger will log via the
5116  * browser 'console' object.  Otherwise, it will use the
5117  * native Logger plugin.
5118  */
5119 logger.useConsole = function (value) {
5120     if (arguments.length) UseConsole = !!value;
5121 
5122     if (UseConsole) {
5123         if (typeof console == "undefined") {
5124             throw new Error("global console object is not defined");
5125         }
5126 
5127         if (typeof console.log != "function") {
5128             throw new Error("global console object does not have a log function");
5129         }
5130 
5131         if (typeof console.useLogger == "function") {
5132             if (console.useLogger()) {
5133                 throw new Error("console and logger are too intertwingly");
5134             }
5135         }
5136     }
5137 
5138     return UseConsole;
5139 };
5140 
5141 /**
5142  * Logs a message at the LOG level.
5143  *
5144  * Parameters passed after message are used applied to
5145  * the message with utils.format()
5146  */
5147 logger.log   = function(message) { logWithArgs("LOG",   arguments); };
5148 
5149 /**
5150  * Logs a message at the ERROR level.
5151  *
5152  * Parameters passed after message are used applied to
5153  * the message with utils.format()
5154  */
5155 logger.error = function(message) { logWithArgs("ERROR", arguments); };
5156 
5157 /**
5158  * Logs a message at the WARN level.
5159  *
5160  * Parameters passed after message are used applied to
5161  * the message with utils.format()
5162  */
5163 logger.warn  = function(message) { logWithArgs("WARN",  arguments); };
5164 
5165 /**
5166  * Logs a message at the INFO level.
5167  *
5168  * Parameters passed after message are used applied to
5169  * the message with utils.format()
5170  */
5171 logger.info  = function(message) { logWithArgs("INFO",  arguments); };
5172 
5173 /**
5174  * Logs a message at the DEBUG level.
5175  *
5176  * Parameters passed after message are used applied to
5177  * the message with utils.format()
5178  */
5179 logger.debug = function(message) { logWithArgs("DEBUG", arguments); };
5180 
5181 // log at the specified level with args
5182 function logWithArgs(level, args) {
5183     args = [level].concat([].slice.call(args));
5184     logger.logLevel.apply(logger, args);
5185 }
5186 
5187 /**
5188  * Logs a message at the specified level.
5189  *
5190  * Parameters passed after message are used applied to
5191  * the message with utils.format()
5192  */
5193 logger.logLevel = function(level, message /* , ... */) {
5194     // format the message with the parameters
5195     var formatArgs = [].slice.call(arguments, 2);
5196     message    = utils.vformat(message, formatArgs);
5197 
5198     if (LevelsMap[level] === null) {
5199         throw new Error("invalid logging level: " + level);
5200     }
5201 
5202     if (LevelsMap[level] > CurrentLevel) return;
5203 
5204     // queue the message if not yet at deviceready
5205     if (!DeviceReady && !UseConsole) {
5206         Queued.push([level, message]);
5207         return;
5208     }
5209 
5210     // if not using the console, use the native logger
5211     if (!UseConsole) {
5212         exec(null, null, "Logger", "logLevel", [level, message]);
5213         return;
5214     }
5215 
5216     // make sure console is not using logger
5217     if (console.__usingCordovaLogger) {
5218         throw new Error("console and logger are too intertwingly");
5219     }
5220 
5221     // log to the console
5222     switch (level) {
5223         case logger.LOG:   console.log(message); break;
5224         case logger.ERROR: console.log("ERROR: " + message); break;
5225         case logger.WARN:  console.log("WARN: "  + message); break;
5226         case logger.INFO:  console.log("INFO: "  + message); break;
5227         case logger.DEBUG: console.log("DEBUG: " + message); break;
5228     }
5229 };
5230 
5231 // when deviceready fires, log queued messages
5232 logger.__onDeviceReady = function() {
5233     if (DeviceReady) return;
5234 
5235     DeviceReady = true;
5236 
5237     for (var i=0; i<Queued.length; i++) {
5238         var messageArgs = Queued[i];
5239         logger.logLevel(messageArgs[0], messageArgs[1]);
5240     }
5241 
5242     Queued = null;
5243 };
5244 
5245 // add a deviceready event to log queued messages
5246 document.addEventListener("deviceready", logger.__onDeviceReady, false);
5247 
5248 });

5251 define("cordova/plugin/network", function(require, exports, module) {

5253     cordova = require('cordova'),

5255 
5256 var NetworkConnection = function () {
5257     this.type = null;
5258     this._firstRun = true;
5259     this._timer = null;
5260     this.timeout = 500;
5261 
5262     var me = this;
5263 
5264     channel.onCordovaReady.subscribeOnce(function() {
5265         me.getInfo(function (info) {
5266             me.type = info;
5267             if (info === "none") {
5268                 // set a timer if still offline at the end of timer send the offline event
5269                 me._timer = setTimeout(function(){
5270                     cordova.fireDocumentEvent("offline");
5271                     me._timer = null;
5272                     }, me.timeout);
5273             } else {
5274                 // If there is a current offline event pending clear it
5275                 if (me._timer !== null) {
5276                     clearTimeout(me._timer);
5277                     me._timer = null;
5278                 }
5279                 cordova.fireDocumentEvent("online");
5280             }
5281 
5282             // should only fire this once
5283             if (me._firstRun) {
5284                 me._firstRun = false;
5285                 channel.onCordovaConnectionReady.fire();
5286             }
5287         },
5288         function (e) {
5289             // If we can't get the network info we should still tell Cordova
5290             // to fire the deviceready event.
5291             if (me._firstRun) {
5292                 me._firstRun = false;
5293                 channel.onCordovaConnectionReady.fire();
5294             }
5295             console.log("Error initializing Network Connection: " + e);
5296         });
5297     });
5298 };

5375 define("cordova/plugin/requestFileSystem", function(require, exports, module) {
5376 var FileError = require('cordova/plugin/FileError'),
5377     FileSystem = require('cordova/plugin/FileSystem'),
5378     exec = require('cordova/exec');
5379 
5380 /**
5381  * Request a file system in which to store application data.
5382  * @param type  local file system type
5383  * @param size  indicates how much storage space, in bytes, the application expects to need
5384  * @param successCallback  invoked with a FileSystem object
5385  * @param errorCallback  invoked if error occurs retrieving file system
5386  */
5387 var requestFileSystem = function(type, size, successCallback, errorCallback) {
5388     var fail = function(code) {
5389         if (typeof errorCallback === 'function') {
5390             errorCallback(new FileError(code));
5391         }
5392     };
5393 
5394     if (type < 0 || type > 3) {
5395         fail(FileError.SYNTAX_ERR);
5396     } else {
5397         // if successful, return a FileSystem object
5398         var success = function(file_system) {
5399             if (file_system) {
5400                 if (typeof successCallback === 'function') {
5401                     // grab the name and root from the file system object
5402                     var result = new FileSystem(file_system.name, file_system.root);
5403                     successCallback(result);
5404                 }
5405             }
5406             else {
5407                 // no FileSystem object returned
5408                 fail(FileError.NOT_FOUND_ERR);
5409             }
5410         };
5411         exec(success, fail, "File", "requestFileSystem", [type, size]);
5412     }
5413 };
5414 
5415 module.exports = requestFileSystem;
5416 });

5418 // file: lib/common/plugin/resolveLocalFileSystemURI.js
5419 define("cordova/plugin/resolveLocalFileSystemURI", function(require, exports, module) {
5420 var DirectoryEntry = require('cordova/plugin/DirectoryEntry'),
5421     FileEntry = require('cordova/plugin/FileEntry'),
5422     FileError = require('cordova/plugin/FileError'),
5423     exec = require('cordova/exec');
5424 
5425 /**
5426  * Look up file system Entry referred to by local URI.
5427  * @param {DOMString} uri  URI referring to a local file or directory
5428  * @param successCallback  invoked with Entry object corresponding to URI
5429  * @param errorCallback    invoked if error occurs retrieving file system entry
5430  */
5431 module.exports = function(uri, successCallback, errorCallback) {
5432     // error callback
5433     var fail = function(error) {
5434         if (typeof errorCallback === 'function') {
5435             errorCallback(new FileError(error));
5436         }
5437     };
5438     // sanity check for 'not:valid:filename'
5439     if(!uri || uri.split(":").length > 2) {
5440         setTimeout( function() {
5441             fail(FileError.ENCODING_ERR);
5442         },0);
5443         return;
5444     }
5445     // if successful, return either a file or directory entry
5446     var success = function(entry) {
5447         var result;
5448         if (entry) {
5449             if (typeof successCallback === 'function') {
5450                 // create appropriate Entry object
5451                 result = (entry.isDirectory) ? new DirectoryEntry(entry.name, entry.fullPath) : new FileEntry(entry.name, entry.fullPath);
5452                 try {
5453                     successCallback(result);
5454                 }
5455                 catch (e) {
5456                     console.log('Error invoking callback: ' + e);
5457                 }
5458             }
5459         }
5460         else {
5461             // no Entry object returned
5462             fail(FileError.NOT_FOUND_ERR);
5463         }
5464     };
5465 
5466     exec(success, fail, "File", "resolveLocalFileSystemURI", [uri]);
5467 };

5485 define("cordova/utils", function(require, exports, module) {
5486 var utils = exports;
5487 
5488 /**
5489  * Returns an indication of whether the argument is an array or not
5490  */
5491 utils.isArray = function(a) {
5492     return Object.prototype.toString.call(a) == '[object Array]';
5493 };
5494 
5495 /**
5496  * Returns an indication of whether the argument is a Date or not
5497  */
5498 utils.isDate = function(d) {
5499     return Object.prototype.toString.call(d) == '[object Date]';
5500 };
5501 
5502 /**
5503  * Does a deep clone of the object.
5504  */
5505 utils.clone = function(obj) {
5506     if(!obj || typeof obj == 'function' || utils.isDate(obj) || typeof obj != 'object') {
5507         return obj;
5508     }
5509 
5510     var retVal, i;
5511 
5512     if(utils.isArray(obj)){
5513         retVal = [];
5514         for(i = 0; i < obj.length; ++i){
5515             retVal.push(utils.clone(obj[i]));
5516         }
5517         return retVal;
5518     }
5519 
5520     retVal = {};
5521     for(i in obj){
5522         if(!(i in retVal) || retVal[i] != obj[i]) {
5523             retVal[i] = utils.clone(obj[i]);
5524         }
5525     }
5526     return retVal;
5527 };
5528 
5529 /**
5530  * Returns a wrappered version of the function
5531  */
5532 utils.close = function(context, func, params) {
5533     if (typeof params == 'undefined') {
5534         return function() {
5535             return func.apply(context, arguments);
5536         };
5537     } else {
5538         return function() {
5539             return func.apply(context, params);
5540         };
5541     }
5542 };
5543 
5544 /**
5545  * Create a UUID
5546  */
5547 utils.createUUID = function() {
5548     return UUIDcreatePart(4) + '-' +
5549         UUIDcreatePart(2) + '-' +
5550         UUIDcreatePart(2) + '-' +
5551         UUIDcreatePart(2) + '-' +
5552         UUIDcreatePart(6);
5553 };

5555 /**
5556  * Extends a child object from a parent object using classical inheritance
5557  * pattern.
5558  */
5559 utils.extend = (function() {
5560     // proxy used to establish prototype chain
5561     var F = function() {};
5562     // extend Child from Parent
5563     return function(Child, Parent) {
5564         F.prototype = Parent.prototype;
5565         Child.prototype = new F();
5566         Child.__super__ = Parent.prototype;
5567         Child.prototype.constructor = Child;
5568     };
5569 }());

5571 /**
5572  * Alerts a message in any available way: alert or console.log.
5573  */
5574 utils.alert = function(msg) {
5575     if (alert) {
5576         alert(msg);
5577     } else if (console && console.log) {
5578         console.log(msg);
5579     }

5582 /**
5583  * Formats a string and arguments following it ala sprintf()
5584  *
5585  * see utils.vformat() for more information
5586  */
5587 utils.format = function(formatString /* ,... */) {
5588     var args = [].slice.call(arguments, 1);
5589     return utils.vformat(formatString, args);
5590 };
5591 
5592 /**
5593  * Formats a string and arguments following it ala vsprintf()
5594  *
5595  * format chars:
5596  *   %j - format arg as JSON
5597  *   %o - format arg as JSON
5598  *   %c - format arg as ''
5599  *   %% - replace with '%'
5600  * any other char following % will format it's
5601  * arg via toString().
5602  *
5603  * for rationale, see FireBug's Console API:
5604  *    http://getfirebug.com/wiki/index.php/Console_API
5605  */
5606 utils.vformat = function(formatString, args) {
5607     if (formatString === null || formatString === undefined) return "";
5608     if (arguments.length == 1) return formatString.toString();
5609     if (typeof formatString != "string") return formatString.toString();
5610 
5611     var pattern = /(.*?)%(.)(.*)/;
5612     var rest    = formatString;
5613     var result  = [];
5614 
5615     while (args.length) {
5616         var arg   = args.shift();
5617         var match = pattern.exec(rest);
5618 
5619         if (!match) break;
5620 
5621         rest = match[3];
5622 
5623         result.push(match[1]);
5624 
5625         if (match[2] == '%') {
5626             result.push('%');
5627             args.unshift(arg);
5628             continue;
5629         }
5630 
5631         result.push(formatted(arg, match[2]));
5632     }
5633 
5634     result.push(rest);
5635 
5636     return result.join('');
5637 };
5638 
5639 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5640 function UUIDcreatePart(length) {
5641     var uuidpart = "";
5642     for (var i=0; i<length; i++) {
5643         var uuidchar = parseInt((Math.random() * 256), 10).toString(16);
5644         if (uuidchar.length == 1) {
5645             uuidchar = "0" + uuidchar;
5646         }
5647         uuidpart += uuidchar;
5648     }
5649     return uuidpart;
5650 }
5651 
5652 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5653 function formatted(object, formatChar) {
5654 
5655     try {
5656         switch(formatChar) {
5657             case 'j':
5658             case 'o': return JSON.stringify(object);
5659             case 'c': return '';
5660         }
5661     }
5662     catch (e) {
5663         return "error JSON.stringify()ing argument: " + e;
5664     }
5665 
5666     if ((object === null) || (object === undefined)) {
5667         return Object.prototype.toString.call(object);
5668     }
5669 
5670     return object.toString();
5671 }
5672 
5673 });

5688                         base = require('cordova/common'),

5699                     // the window object.
5700                     if (typeof platform.merges !== 'undefined') {
5701                         builder.build(platform.merges).intoAndMerge(window);
5702                     }
5703 
5704                     // Call the platform-specific initialization
5705                     platform.initialize();
5706 
5707                     // Fire event to notify that all objects are created
5708                     channel.onCordovaReady.fire();
5709 
5710                     // Fire onDeviceReady event once all constructors have run and
5711                     // cordova info has been received from native side.
5712                     channel.join(function() {
5713                         require('cordova').fireDocumentEvent('deviceready');
5714                     }, channel.deviceReadyChannelsArray);
5715 
5716                 }, [ channel.onDOMContentLoaded, channel.onNativeReady ]);
5717             }
5718         };
